dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The U.S. is officially not joining the international vaccine coalition Covax, which is co-led by the World Health Organization.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The U.S. is officially not joining the international vaccine coalition Covax, which is co-led by the World Health Organization.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. announced Tuesday that it would not join an international coalition to find and distribute a Covid-19 vaccine worldwide due to the group's association with the World Health Organization, the latest sign of the Trump administration withdrawing the country from the international health community's response to the pandemic over political concerns. Covax is co-led by the World Health Organization, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations and Gavi, which aims to purchase 2 billion doses of potential Covid-19 shots from several vaccine makers by the end of 2021 and distribute them worldwide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the White House spokesman, uh, Judd Deere, said they won't be constrained by what they call a corrupt WHO influenced by China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the White House spokesman, uh, Judd Deere, said they won't be constrained by what they call a corrupt W H O influenced by China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The United States will continue to engage our international partners to ensure we defeat this virus, but we will not be constrained by multilateral organizations influenced by the corrupt World Health Organization and China, said Judd Deere, a spokesman for the White House.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right—and this coalition, Covax, it's aiming to secure 2 billion vaccine doses by early 2022 for global access.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right-and this coalition, Covax, it's aiming to secure two billion vaccine doses by early twenty twenty two for global access.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Covax is co-led by the World Health Organization, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations and Gavi, which aims to purchase 2 billion doses of potential Covid-19 shots from several vaccine makers by the end of 2021 and distribute them worldwide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is a huge number. And they've got like 175 countries already in talks to join.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is a huge number. And they've got like one hundred seventy five countries already in talks to join.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The WHO announced last week that Covax plans to work with vaccine manufacturers to provide countries worldwide equitable access to safe and effective vaccines, once they are licensed and approved, and that 172 countries are engaged in discussions to potentially participate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile the EU just pledged 400 million euros, and France signed on too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile the E U just pledged four hundred million euros, and France signed on too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Monday, the European Commission confirmed it would contribute 400 million euros ($478 million) to the initiative, and the WHO said Germany had joined the pact as well.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But the U.S. is going it alone, partly because they feel they've got enough vaccine candidates in advanced trials already.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the U.S. is going it alone, partly because they feel they've got enough vaccine candidates in advanced trials already.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Washington Post, Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar had interest in exploring some type of role in Covax but there was resistance in some corners of the government and a belief that the U.S. has enough coronavirus vaccine candidates in advanced clinical trials that it can go it alone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's such a stark contrast to what the WHO chief Tedros has been saying—you know, warning against vaccine nationalism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's such a stark contrast to what the W H O chief Tedros has been saying-you know, warning against vaccine nationalism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World Health Organization has warned against vaccine nationalism, with WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stating, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together, because it's a globalized world: the economies are intertwined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He said, um, "for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He said, um, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World Health Organization has warned against vaccine nationalism, with WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stating, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together, because it's a globalized world: the economies are intertwined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And you've got experts like Suerie Moon from Geneva saying this move is a real blow to global cooperation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And you've got experts like Suerie Moon from Geneva saying this move is a real blow to global cooperation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the U.S. says it is not going to participate in any sort of multilateral effort to secure vaccines, it's a real blow, said Suerie Moon, co-director of the Global Health Center at the Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies in Geneva.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though—the article mentions that Health Secretary Alex Azar actually had some interest in joining Covax, but there was pushback within the government.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though-the article mentions that Health Secretary Alex Azar actually had some interest in joining Covax, but there was pushback within the government.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Washington Post, Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar had interest in exploring some type of role in Covax but there was resistance in some corners of the government and a belief that the U.S. has enough coronavirus vaccine candidates in advanced clinical trials that it can go it alone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, political concerns overriding public health strategy once again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, political concerns overriding public health strategy once again.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And remember back in May when Trump froze funding to the WHO? This feels like an extension of that stance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And remember back in May when Trump froze funding to the W H O? This feels like an extension of that stance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In early April, Trump blasted the World Health Organization, saying they called it wrong on the virus, that the WHO was very China-centric in its approach, and froze U.S. funding to the organization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And now with the formal withdrawal process started in July, it's just… consistent, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And now with the formal withdrawal process started in July, it's just... consistent, I guess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In July, the administration sent a letter signaling its intent to withdraw from the WHO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then you have leaders like Denmark's prime minister saying equal access is key—this can't be a race with a few winners.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then you have leaders like Denmark's prime minister saying equal access is key-this can't be a race with a few winners.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Equal access to a COVID-19 vaccine is the key to beating the virus and paving the way for recovery from the pandemic, said Stefan Löfven, the prime minister of Sweden.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's a tough balance between national interest and global solidarity, especially in a pandemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a tough balance between national interest and global solidarity, especially in a pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Let's see how this plays out as vaccines get closer to approval.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Let's see how this plays out as vaccines get closer to approval.
